name: NetBIOS Response Brute Force Spoof (Direct)
author: vvalien
hdm <x@hdm.io>
tombkeeper
description:
This module continuously spams NetBIOS responses to a target for given hostname,
        causing the target to cache a malicious address for this name. On high-speed local
        networks, the PPSRATE value should be increased to speed up this attack. As an
        example, a value of around 30,000 is almost 100% successful when spoofing a
        response for a 'WPAD' lookup. Distant targets may require more time and lower
        rates for a successful attack.

options.name: WORKSPACE
options.description: Specify the workspace for this module

options.name: RHOSTS
options.description: The target host(s), range CIDR identifier, or hosts file with syntax 'file:<path>'

options.name: NBNAME
options.description: The NetBIOS name to spoof a reply for

options.name: NBADDR
options.description: The address that the NetBIOS name should resolve to

options.name: PPSRATE
options.description: The rate at which to send NetBIOS replies
